title: Sri Lanka appoints cabinet committee to fast-track FDI amid soft-peg collapse
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka has appointed a cabinet sub-committee made up of key ministers to fast-track foreign investment proposals stuck at various agencies Media Minister Nalaka Godahewa said.

There are some proposals that have come to the Urban Development Ministry for land and directly to other ministries which will be assessed by the committee and directed to the Finance Ministry, he said.
The Finance Ministry officials are too busy to evaluate them so we will assess them, he said.

The committee will have Minister Godahewa Transport and Industries Minister Dilum Amunugama, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera, Ports and Shipping Minister Pramitha Bandara Tennakoon and Urban Development State Minister Lohan Ratwatte.
He said Sri Lanka needed foreign investments with the collapse of the exchange rate.
Sri Lanka has a soft-pegged exchange rate which collapses whenever economists make open market operations aggressive to boost growth with stimulus (printing money) to close an output gap.
Analysts have warned that unless the central bank and its open market operations are restrained by law, soft-peg crises would continue as they had done in the past 72 years. (Colombo/May04/2022)
